en.title: Online Energy Converter ‚Äî J, cal, Wh

overview.title: About Energy Converter
overview.content: Our energy converter allows you to quickly and accurately convert between different energy measurement units. Supports all major units: Joules, calories, and watt-hours.

calculation.title: How Conversion Works
calculation.content: All energy units are converted through the base unit - Joule. Each unit has its own conversion formula, ensuring calculation accuracy.

units.title: Supported Units
units.content: The converter supports 3 main energy units: Joules (J), calories (cal), and watt-hours (Wh).

advantages.title: Advantages of Our Converter
advantages.content: Accurate calculations, instant conversion, 4 languages support, user-friendly interface, mobile version.

faqItems.q: How to convert Joules to calories?
faqItems.a: Divide Joules by 4.184 to get calories. For example: 4.184 J = 4.184 √∑ 4.184 = 1 cal.

faqItems.q: How to convert Wh to Joules?
faqItems.a: Multiply Wh by 3600 to get Joules. For example: 1 Wh = 1 √ó 3600 = 3600 J.

faqItems.q: How to convert calories to Wh?
faqItems.a: Multiply calories by 4.184, then divide by 3600. For example: 1 cal = 1 √ó 4.184 √∑ 3600 = 0.00116 Wh.
A watt-hour is a unit of energy equal to the energy consumed by a device with a power of 1 watt for 1 hour.

faqItems.a: Teilen Sie Joule durch 4,184, um Kalorien zu erhalten. Zum Beispiel: 4,184 J = 4,184 √∑ 4,184 = 1 cal.
